0.Pros: Great atmosphere great people great customers
0.Cons: poor pay poor training could make the job better

1.Pros: There was minimal heavy lifting and the crew was okay. The hours were somewhat flexible and it was a good entry level job.
1.Cons: Management was quick to criticize employees and the customers were not always the best. The pay was also pretty low.

2.Pros: Honestly, customer service is a great first job. I've been doing cashier, so it's almost too easy. I did big "unofficial jobs" before so this is long overdue, but the cons teach you how to survive.
2.Cons: The usual. Seems to really depend on managers. Everyone at the franchise I'm at is talking about leaving. I had a guy mess up my drawer I'm 99% sure on purpose. But I really don't blame the employees (who do need to learn when to leave their mouth shut.)

3.Pros: you got to meet a lot of new people who are young and lively
3.Cons: constantly getting dirty, rude customers, pressure

4.Pros: You can get some great experience. Benefits were mediocre but they were more than willing to work with your school schedule or if you had another job.
4.Cons: The hours were horrible. It is not your typical 9-5 job. Sometimes working overnight or early early in the morning. The pay could be way better.

5.Cons: didn't get enough hours to work

6.Cons: Management was not helpful at all

7.Pros: My coworkers and managers were really fun to work with. It didn't feel like I was working because we were all laughing so much.
7.Cons: The customers could be rude and yell and we as employees had to take it and make the customer happy even if it wasn't our fault.

8.Pros: Good first job. It is fast food so you cant keep high standards.
8.Cons: Scheduling was difficult. Often didn't know your schedule until the day of.

9.Cons: A lot of stress not enough crew overnight, and favoritism from the store manager
